Dear Marc Christian Porter:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
8/28/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan
is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed or
implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at .
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include documentation
of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
2

(e) Three dated references which are obtained
prior to employment from persons unrelated to the
employee and which are less than 12 months old.
(i) Directly from the Michigan state police or
the equivalent state law enforcement agency,
Canadian province, or other country where the
person usually resides or has resided in the
previous 5 years.
Eight out of twelve employee files did not have references dated within 12 months
of hire.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include documentation
of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(g) If the employee has criminal convictions, the
institution shall complete a written evaluation of the
convictions that addresses the nature of the
conviction, the length of time since the conviction,
and the relationship of the conviction to regulated
activity for the purpose of determining suitability for
employment in the institution.
One out of twelve employee files did not have the written evaluation completed for
an employee with criminal convictions.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include documentation
of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department
of human services, the equivalent state or Canadian
provincial agency, or equivalent agency in the
country where the person usually resides, that the
person has not been determined to be a perpetrator
of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to
3

the start of employment and every 12 months
thereafter.
One out of twelve employee files did not have a statement from the employee
concerning her criminal conviction.
CCI Rule 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and
volunteers
(1) The licensee shall document, prior to
employment, that each employee and volunteer who
has contact with residents 4 or more hours per
week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from
communicable tuberculosis shall be verified within
the 1 year period before employment and shall be
verified every 1 year after the last verification or
prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Nine out of twelve employees did not have documentation prior to employment
(with residents 4 or more hours per week for more than two consecutive weeks)
that their TB tests were completed.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was provided for R.400.4114. The agency did not have
documentation that the employees had received their TB tests prior to time frames
outlined in this rule. The agency was given technical assistance in this area. The
agency may have the employees' results for their TB tests before their hire date or
after their hire date, as long as they are documenting clearly when the employee's
come into contact with residents 4 or more hours a week for more than 2
consecutive weeks. An employee "hire date" and "floor date" was discussed to
reveal the distinction in time frames.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not provided.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
I reviewed the audit and the agency is in compliance.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
The agency is in compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency completed the assessment. The audit revealed there were no barriers
in their progress and they have improved services.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The staff spoke highly of their agency. There were no concerns among the staff.
The youth were well dressed and hygiene was taking care of. All youth were
engaged in their treatment and were respectful while this writer talked to them.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has older buildings that are currently being renovated in minor ways.
There is new carpeting in one building and new paint. The newest building is well
maintained. The school is also well maintained, and the grounds are well kept.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
5

Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
